column4: Celeron can be a Cache-reduced p4, p3 or p2 depending on the speed
this box is a Celeron 2Ghz... a cache-reduced p4
Then a 300MHz sounds likely to be a P2?
so it is.
I keep forgetting what all those old-fashioned 32-bit processors were :)
nice way of saying you got a 64-bit one.
Hehe
what speed?
what speed?
care to do a little test?
What sort of test?
pi calculating speed test
I have a cooling problem here - can't stress the box due to a shitty fan ;)
I can try
Mine does. I had to yank some screws out of the walls to fit the fan..when it goes wrong, it's up to 100 degrees.
It was healthy at first - about 30-40 degrees
100 DEGREES!?!? THAT would toast IT!
I know. It could of course be a sensor issue, but it feels *very* hot.
I'm buying a new fan meant for this mobo when I have money again
I have Thermaltake at the moment, which included screws that wouldn't fit on any motherboard I've seen :/
